text:
THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 14, 1863

SOME PLAIN WORDS AND A FAIR OFFER.

[Editorial Note]

We have just received a few CASES OF FRESH OYSTERS, which will be sold at COST

AT THE ROCK BOTTOM STORE.

ALSO A FEW CASES

DRY GOODS, GROCERIES, BOOTS AND SHOES,
RUBBERS, CROCKERY and NI'KLE-PLATED CUTLERY.

Our Motto: Small Profits and Quick Returns.

H. WALTERS, F. C. BAKER,

HORSE SHOE STORE,

RIVER STREET.

A month's work done, John comes to town.
To buy a suit of clothes, he must first take a friend's advice.
Who will give him the best?
He went into another store.
And twenty dollars paid.
To get his clothes, he had to settle.
That foolish lad had made.

Follow this advice. Do not pay $20 for a suit of clothes you can get for $15.

Boots, Shoes Mocassins Underclothing, Shirts, Dry Goods, etc., etc.,
All and everything at the same reduction. Give us a call.

THOMAS O. DAVIS.

C. D. NORTHGRAVES,
Watchmaker and Jeweller,
(At T. N. Campbell's New Store)

A LARGE STOCK OF

Watches, Clocks and Jewellery

KEPT CONSTANTLY ON HAND

Repairing Promptly Attended to

Potatoes.

Potatoes.

On hand and for sale. Potatoes in lots.

E. W. SMITH
COMMUNICATIONS.

A GOOD IDEA.
To the Editor of the Times.
With reference to the knowledge of the liberal and generous spirit of the inhabitants of Prince Albert, I have no doubt that they will be willing to assist me in carrying out my plan. I hope to obtain from them an adequate building site for the school, which I propose to establish here at Prince Albert. The school will be conducted by Mr. J. Sinclair, who has been engaged in teaching for many years. The school will be open to all children between the ages of five and fifteen, and will be conducted according to the best methods known. I am confident that the school will be a great benefit to the people of Prince Albert.

Hugh M'Dougall.
East End Bakery.

TO THE LADIES.

Milinery and Ladies Furnishings

MISS MACK & CO.,
Campbell's Block,
River Street,
Prince Albert, N.W.T.

W. J. CARTER,
Builder and Contractor.

TRIAL HUGH M'DOUGALL'S BREAD!

J. SINGLAR,
Merchant Taylor,
Prince Albert, N.W.T.

ALARGESTOCK ARRIVED A FEW DAYS AGO AT THE MEDICAL HALL.

CONSISTING OF
Drugs, Chemicals, Dye Stuffs, Spices, Druggists' Sundries, Perfumery, Sponges, Toilet Soaps, etc., etc., AND ARE NOW OPENED OUT.

Patent Medicines,

INCLUDING
Fellow's Syrup, St. Jacob's Oil, Electric Oil, Pain Destroyer, Black Oil, Burdock Blood Bitters, Vegetable Discovery, Cod Liver Oil Emulsion, Medical Discovery, August Flower, Etc., Etc.

TERMS--CASH.

T. E. JACKSON,
In our New Premises, next door east of Farmers' Home and north of Old Presbyterian Church.

HUDSON'S BAY CO.'Y.

FARMING LANDS!

FOR SALE IN
Manitoba & North-west

The Hudson's Bay Company own 5,000,000 acres in the Great Fertile Belt, and now offer for sale 1,000,000 acres, already surveyed by the Government of Canada.

ALSO
TOWN LOTS FOR SALE

In Winnipeg, West Lynne, Rat Portage, Portage la Prairie and Goshen, N.W.T.

The above will be disposed of at reasonable prices and on easy terms of payment. Full information in regard to these lands will be given at the offices of the Company in Winnipeg and Montreal.

C. J. BRAYCOES, Land Commissioner.

BLACKSMITHING Farmers' Restaurant.

Horseshoeing, Carriage Repairing & Sleigh Ironing.

Chester Thompson.
Prince Albert, N.W.T.

R. J. O'LEARY
Proprietor.
SEE HERE!

There now on hand the last stock of Groceries ever offered to the people of Prince Albert, which I will sell at bottom prices. Give me a call.

A. L. ASHDOWN

1879. As a proof that close buyers are also in their interests, and that we practice what we advertise, our store has been thronged with customers during the past week, more people being served than during any one week this season.

GRAND ANNUAL CLEARING SALE!
STILL GOING ON AT BUFFALO HALL

Our business improves every month.

Reliable goods sold at fair profits, and advertising facts only.

BETTS & Gwynne.

T. N. Campbell,
Bookseller and Stationer

Prince Albert - N.W.T.
